column4: I accidentally messed up my groups my user. Now I can't do no more sudo, as it claims I am not in the sudoers file.. Help please
reboot to the recovery console (at GRUB) and usermod -G admin -a [yourusername]

You need to be in the admin group to sudo, that previous command adds you there.  You'll probably need to re-add all your other groups too: adm dialout cdrom floppy audio dip video plugdev lpadmin scanner admin
